page.title: 11CUSTOMS-ROSE GREEN
page.content: Mrs.Ben moved with her family to Hewarts Lane in 1938.It was very countryfied then with only a few houses and shops.There was a village hall in Rose Green Road where the Scouts,Guides and Sunday School met. There was also a baker who sold hot loaves for 4 old pence.Near by there was a cafe,a butcher,a fish&chip shop, a grocer and two green grocers.There was farm land all around and cows grazed on Avisford Park.East of Carlton Avenue was marshland where watercress grew.It had to be drained before building could take place. Children had lovely places to play. They could wander for miles and be quite safe.Mrs.Ben likes living in Rose Green because her friends and family are there.However she thinks it is now too large and busy.She liked it better as it was.
